block.p: Michelle Sara Effron, a daughter of Tova and Barry Effron of White Plains, is to be married today to David Harris Levine, the son of Ruth and Jules Levine, also of White Plains. Rabbi Chaim Marder will perform the ceremony at the Beth El Synagogue Center in New Rochelle, N.Y.
The bride, 23, and the bridegroom, 24, graduated from Brandeis University, both cum laude.

Michelle Sara Effron, a daughter of Tova and Barry Effron of White Plains, is to be married today to David Harris Levine, the son of Ruth and Jules Levine, also of White Plains. Rabbi Chaim Marder will perform the ceremony at the Beth El Synagogue Center in New Rochelle, N.Y.
The bride, 23, and the bridegroom, 24, graduated from Brandeis University, both cum laude.

The bride is a health care analyst in Stamford, Conn., for William M. Mercer, a benefits consulting business. Both of her parents retired from Effron Enterprises, a consulting and computer software company, and from Plan Sponsor Network, a provider of investment-management database services, both formerly in Port Chester, N.Y. The bride's father was the president of the two companies, and her mother was their secretary and treasurer. The bride's father now sits on the board of the UJA-Federation of New York and is the chairman of its Westchester campaign; her mother is a director of Westchester Jewish Community Services.

The bridegroom is about to begin his third year at Brooklyn Law School and until earlier this month was a summer associate at Chadbourne & Parke, a Manhattan law firm. His mother is a guidance counselor at George Washington High School in Manhattan. His father is the deputy superintendent for the public high schools in the Bronx.
